page.title: 05Farming: Trewinnard Manor
page.content: In the parish of St.Erth in Western Cornwall stands a fine old mansion known as Trewinnard. This name which is purely Celtic signifies the Town or Farm of the Thrush (winnard).Trewinnard is sweetly placed upon a wooded slope which rises up from the banks of the River Hayle. Parts of the present stately mansion with its fine rooms, plaster ceilings and old world garden date back to Elizabethan times however the main part of the house is Georgian. Local records show that there was a de Trewinnard as far back as l3O2.The last local de Trewinnard Rufus was dispossessed of the house and the grounds in Elizabethan times when he murdered a villager and was condemmed to death, a sentence commuted to loss of lands etc.
